trans-unit.source: Destroy all lands.
A bloody dawn broke over a scabbed and tortured world.

trans-unit.resname: V14·2 | Burning of Xinye | Card Text
trans-unit.source: You destroy four lands you control, then target opponent destroys four lands he or she controls. Then Burning of Xinye deals 4 damage to each creature.
Each player chooses from among the permanents he or she controls an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, then sacrifices the rest.
"Keep with you only this much: your mount, your blade, and your wits. The rest you can find, build, or take."\n—Horse clans' wisdom

trans-unit.resname: V14·4 | Child of Alara | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Trample When Child of Alara dies, destroy all nonland permanents. They can't be regenerated.

trans-unit.resname: V14·4 | Child of Alara | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: The progeny of the Maelstrom shows no allegiance—and no mercy—to any of the five shards.

trans-unit.resname: V14·5 | Decree of Annihilation | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Exile all artifacts, creatures, and lands from the battlefield, all cards from all graveyards, and all cards from all hands. Cycling {5}{R}{R} ({5}{R}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.) When you cycle Decree of Annihilation, destroy all lands.
Firespout deals 3 damage to each creature without flying if {R} was spent to cast Firespout and 3 damage to each creature with flying if {G} was spent to cast it. (Do both if {R}{G} was spent.)
Destroy all artifacts and enchantments. You gain 2 life for each permanent destroyed this way.
Elvish dawnhands test a relic's worthiness before collecting it for the safehold. If it can't stand up to a stiff breeze, it's left behind.
Each player exiles all creature cards from his or her graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures he or she controls, then puts all cards he or she exiled this way onto the battlefield.
Put X 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield. If X is 5 or more, destroy all other creatures.
Their war forgotten, the nations of Bant stood united in the face of a common threat.
Rolling Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without horsemanship and each player.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a soot counter on Smokestack. At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a permanent for each soot counter on Smokestack.
Put all creatures on the bottom of their owners' libraries. Miracle {W} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)
Return all permanents to their owners' hands.
The calm comes after the storm.
Destroy all white creatures.
All must fall, and those who stand highest fall hardest.

trans-unit.resname: V14·15 | Wrath of God | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

trans-unit.resname: V14·15 | Wrath of God | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: Legend speaks of the lost coastal polis of Olantin, whose inhabitants' hubris enraged the sun god Heliod.
